pullrequest.title: Slimmed down the Plugin pull request (no more template specializations)

content.raw:
Just some historical context, we started removing the `Get` prefix on Gazebo as we updated the API to use Ignition libraries and the PIMPL idiom. `sdformat` still has it because it is an older API. I believe the plan is to eventually change all APIs to be consistent. In general, if you see some `Get` function on Gazebo / Ignition / SDF, this means it is old...

I see your point regarding having a verb, but it is not uncommon for APIs to not have a a `get` on getters. But I agree that the fact that `Interface` is both a verb and a noun could be a source of confusion. But at this point, I think the path of least friction is to stick with the latest style and make the API consistent.
